task.title: Increasing the JVM
task.shortdesc: If you are working with large documents with extensive metadata or key references, you will need to increase the Java Virtual Memory (JVM). You can do this from the command-line prompt for a specific session, or you can increase the value of the ANT_OPTS environmental variable.

step.cmd: To change the value for an specific session, from the command prompt, issue the following command:
step.info: This increases the JVM to 1024 megabytes. By default, it is set to 512.

step.cmd: To persistently change the value, change the value allocated to the ANT_OPTS environment variable in the startcmd file that is applicable for your operating system.
